title: The Golden Globe Ambassador: Presenting Hollywood's Next Generation

meta_data.description: Chosen by the HFPA, the Golden Globe Ambassador - previously known as Miss or Mr. Golden Globe - is traditionally the daughter or son of one of the industry's most respected actors/actresses/directors/producers and assists during the Golden Globe Awards ceremony. The tradition started in 1962 and over the years has introduced many second and third-generation stars; among them: Linda Evans, Anne Archer, Laura Dern, Melanie Griffith, and her daughter, Dakota Johnson.
